title: Another Pakistani fishing boat seized by BSF near Sir Creek, total now 4 | india-news | Hindustan Times
text:
Another Pakistani fishing boat seized by BSF near Sir Creek, total now 4 india Updated: Feb 02, 2017 18:52 IST PTI PTI, Bhuj The BSF has seized four abandoned Pakistani fishing boats near Sir Creek in Gujarat’s Kutch district on the Indo-Pak border.(AFP/ Representative photo) 
The Border Security Force (BSF) on Thursday seized one more abandoned Pakistani fishing boat near Sir Creek in Gujarat’s Kutch district on the Indo-Pak border during an extensive search operation in the area, officials said. 
With this latest seizure, the total number of Pakistani fishing boats captured in the creek area has gone up to four in the last three days, they added. 
“BSF has seized a Pakistani fishing boat in the Indian territory of the creek area today (Thursday). Occupants of the boat fled to the neighbouring country before the boat was spotted. This is the fourth such boat seized by BSF troops during the last three days,” a senior BSF official said. 
On Tuesday, BSF seized an abandoned Pakistani fishing boat from Sir Creek, following which an extensive search operation of the creek area has been commenced. 
Later, on Wednesday, two more engine-fitted boats from the neighbouring country were seized by the BSF from the same area, officials said. 
These two boats were abandoned in Pabewari Creek near Sir Creek by Pakistani fishermen, who fled into Pakistani territory after being chased by a BSF patrol party, the official said, adding that nothing suspicious has been found from these boats. 
Pakistani fishing boats are found in creek area at regular intervals. Earlier, such abandoned boats were found in Padala Creek and Haraminala area by the BSF. Read more
